headline: Precious Metals Finish Lower But Turnaround Eyed
summary: Precious metal futures finished lower, but they may not have much further to fall until finding a bottom, said Spartan Capital Securities.

headline: CME Group's Q4 Earnings Coming Up: What's in the Cards?
summary: CME Group heads into Q4 earnings with higher volumes and revenue growth expected, but rising costs and an unfavorable earnings setup add uncertainty.

headline: Gold’s Rout Fails to Dent Bullish Calls at Major Banks
summary: Some major banks say the longer-term investment case remains intact amid expectations for exceptionally strong demand from investors and central banks.

headline: Silver Higher After Friday’s Massive Fall
summary: 0936 ET – Silver futures are up 3.7%, after plunging about 30% Friday.  Strong movements are expected as many traders may take profits from the historic run in silver prices over recent months.  Gold is down 0.3%.

raw.headline: Silver Higher After Friday’s Massive Fall
raw.summary: 0936 ET – Silver futures are up 3.7%, after plunging about 30% Friday.  Strong movements are expected as many traders may take profits from the historic run in silver prices over recent months.  Gold is down 0.3%.

headline: AI Capex Clouds The Tech Horizon, Even As Meta And Tesla Shine
summary: On Thursday, Nasdaq fell 1.3% as the market digested mixed results from some Mag 7 reports. The primary weight came from Microsoft. AI spending anxiety rippled through the software sector.

raw.headline: AI Capex Clouds The Tech Horizon, Even As Meta And Tesla Shine

headline: CME Group Tightens Metals Margins As Volatility Drives Record Trading
summary: CME Group (NasdaqGS:CME) has raised margin requirements on precious metals futures and options after historic price crashes and sharp volatility. The company reports record single day trading volumes in metals contracts during this period of heightened market swings. CME Group is preparing to roll out new silver related products while adjusting risk controls in its existing metals complex. The exchange has also announced a new compliance disciplinary action tied to trading behavior in its...

headline: Silver price shifts have not been seen in almost half a century, UBS says
summary: Investing.com -- Silver’s price plunge marks one of the most extreme moves in the metal’s modern trading history, UBS said, after the price tumbled 26% on Friday with intraday swings nearing 38%.

headline: Gold, Silver Likely to See Continued Volatility
summary: Gold and silver futures rose but volatility across precious metals is likely to remain high in the near term with macro uncertainty, real-rate expectations, and the dollar driving sentiment.

headline: Gold’s Decline Seen as Healthy Correction After ‘Irrational’ Rally
summary: Spot gold was down and J.P. Morgan Private Bank said its recent pullback is a healthy technical correction following an irrational rally.

headline: Global Stocks Fall, Metals Slump as Markets Digest Trump’s Fed Chair Pick
summary: Global stocks fell on Monday and metals tumbled as markets digested President Trump’s nomination of Kevin Warsh as the next chair of the Federal Reserve.

headline: Futu Holdings Wins Five CME Awards, Cementing Industry Leadership in Futures and Options
summary: Futu Holdings Limited (Nasdaq: FUTU), a globally leading securities trading and wealth management fintech platform, is pleased to announce that its subsidiary, Futu Securities International (Hong Kong) Limited ("Futu"), has received five prestigious awards from the Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME). This achievement solidifies Futu's leading position and expertise in the futures and options domain. headline: Is It Too Late To Consider CME Group (CME) After Strong Derivatives Trading Interest?
summary: If you are wondering whether CME Group's current share price lines up with its underlying worth, this article walks through the numbers so you can judge the value for yourself. CME Group last closed at US$289.06, with returns of 2.2% over 7 days, 7.2% over 30 days, 7.2% year to date, 24.5% over 1 year, 83.1% over 3 years, and 82.6% over 5 years. These figures give useful context before looking at what the stock might be worth. Recent news around CME Group has focused on its role as a major...
